content:
Nice little interesting puzzle!

There are two typos in the second paragraph in Goal section:
* "beeing" => "being"
* "so does the missiles" => "so do the missiles"

Thanks.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple mais amusant.   Simple but fun.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Significant comments below.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: This puzzle is quite easy, ok, but it's too long to solve for a simple 15-minutes clash (I speak for me). The statement is clear and the tests are good. So why not ?
Suggestion for an extreme edition: a space invaders like

I like your puzzle and I don't think it is too easy for a puzzle.  I think there are some good opportunities to compare various approaches to gathering and storing the x and y values of the enemy aircraft and the surface to air missile.  This would be a great puzzle for the young people in my life that are fairly new to the coding journey.

Some minor suggestions:

Title: Shoot Enemy Aircraft instead of Shoot enemy aircrafts
(Title case for titles doesn't seem to be 100% standardized on CG, but I like title case for titles, like you did with Hexagonal Maze.)

Goal:

line 1 - aircraft instead of aircrafts
line 4 - missiles instead of missile
line 5 - as the launcher instead of than the launcher, also... it moves instead of it move
line 5 to 8 - some suggestions provided below

The content of the goal is clear and well done.  Consider removing some of the newlines where the sentences flow nicely together.  For instance:

There are enemy aircraft (> or <) in the sky (made of .). Each turn, they move one cell forward. You are in charge of shooting them with a surface to air missile (^). You can only shoot vertically. Each turn, your missiles move one cell up.

Note: When you shoot, the missile appears at the same altitude as the launcher. Each turn, the missile moves one cell up.

You have to print, each turn, if you WAIT or if you SHOOT. You have to shoot all the enemy aircraft, and your stock is just enough, so don't SHOOT if you can't hit an aircraft. After shooting every missile, do not print the last WAITs.
This contribution was first rejected as a CoC because "too difficult", I hope it is not too easy for a puzzle.
All done, thank you for this complete feedback.
Yes, I was thinking about that, and with a referee and graphics it could be nice too. But it is much more work. It will takes time.
Thank you :)
Thank you for approving

Done, thanks.
8 month, usually you are faster ^^

Thank you.

I dunno, I think the statement was updated again after my initial review? ðŸ™‚
It's possible, some people asked for informations in the forum (after the puzzle was approved).

Just a couple more:

Constraints:

Line 3: the plural of aircraft is still aircraft which makes this line a bit challenging.  How about changing "the aircrafts" to "each aircraft"?  I thought about just changing aircrafts to aircraft, but then using aircraft as a singular and a plural in the same sentence made my head spin just a little.

Goal & Constraints:

surface to air should be hyphenated: surface-to-air
Done, thanks

Tell me if I'm driving you crazy, but I have two more.  In this sentence:

You are in charge of shooting them, with a surface-to-air missile (^), you can only shoot vertically.

I'd like to see the first comma removed.  I think the second comma should be changed to a period and a new sentence started with "You...".

In the constraints:

The length of the lines is always the same, and <= 40.

How about this?

The lengths of the lines are always the same, and <= 40.

No, it's OK :smile:
Thank you for your help. I think you understood that english is not my mother tongue.
Some of my favorite puzzles on CG have been authored by you.  I am honored to have had the chance to help on this one.

That's nice, thank you :blush:
But I think this one won't be in any favorite, it is very simple, it was supposed to be a coc ^^
